patient_input.day-description: Felt disconnected and tired most of the day.
patient_input.caregiver-helpful: Let me stay in my room.
patient_input.caregiver-unhelpful: Asked me to eat when I wasn’t ready.
patient_input.comments: Didn’t want to be around anyone.

caregiver_input.comments: She isolated in her room for most of the day.

plan.rationale: Increased isolation can signal relapse risk.

plan.step: Contact clinical team if meal refusal continues.

patient_input.tough-time: Got nervous before dinner, but it went okay once we started talking.
patient_input.day-description: Had breakfast and lunch without much stress. Dinner was harder but I finished it
patient_input.caregiver-helpful: Checks in on me but lets me eat at my own pace.
patient_input.comments: Feeling more in control of my meals this week.

caregiver_input.caloric-intake: Normal for her meal plan. 1800 calories
caregiver_input.comments: She seemed relaxed and even joked during lunch

risk_factors: Patient's self-reported feeling of nervousness before dinner and partial meal avoidance indicate potential relapse risk.
Caregiver's report of patient's joking during lunch may suggest a disconnect between patient's reported feelings and actual emotional state.

plan.step: Increase caregiver presence during meals to provide additional support.
plan.rationale: Helps reinforce patient's reported feelings of being supported and may reduce meal avoidance.
plan.source: Patient's self-report of feeling more in control of meals

plan.step: Encourage open communication about patient's emotions during meals.
plan.rationale: Helps address potential disconnect between patient's reported feelings and actual emotional state.
plan.source: Caregiver's report of patient's joking during lunch
